utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hey you guys, I couldn't get a reservation for the night of my birthday, so we have to do dinner Thursday night instead.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thursday? But that's Halloween.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So spooky, that's all.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, so, is Mike coming to dinner?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! It's my first birthday with a boyfriend, and he has to work. Ugh, I get mad at him, but I think it's a little to soon to show my true colors.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, I would make a reservation for five, because one of us has to stay home and watch Emma. Which one of us should go to dinner?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Actually, um, I was thinking maybe both of us could go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks, I'll put a lot of extra thought into your gift.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alright, okay, so we can all go now. That's fun. Hey, you know what? We all haven't been together, the six of us, in such a long time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you talking about? We're all together right now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um, Mon, Chandler's not here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, dear God!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good morning everyone, it's nice to see our team together for the first time. Now, before we get started, are there any questions? Yes, Ken is it?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: That's right. Is it true the reason you're here in Tulsa is that you fell asleep in a meeting and took the job without realizing what you were saying yes to?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, don't believe everything you hear, Ken. But yeah, that's true. Alright, let's get started by taking a look at last quarter's figures. Ah, Claudia, aren't you supposed to blow smoke up the bosses' ass?

utterance.speaker: Claudia
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Does the smoke bother you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no, no-no-no. I smoked for years, then I quit. Right now, I can't remember why. You're not allowed to smoke in this office. Not right?

utterance.speaker: Claudia
utterance.content: Yes, in Oklahoma it's legal to smoke in offices with fifteen people or less. Would you like one?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Alright, look. I don't smoke anymore. But if the rest of you want to light up, go ahead, it's fine. So you all smoke then? That's almost rude, that I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: That's not true. If you don't wanna smoke ...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ken, please! No, I can't, I can't smoke. If I smoke, my wife would kill me.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I'm sorry, but isn't your wife back in New York?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I always liked you, Ken.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Trick or treat!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, and treat it is.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hmhmm.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, so glad I changed. Almost wore my threadbare robe that can't contain my breasts.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is not, what I'm wearing. I'm ovulating and Chandler's gonna be home any minute, so I thought we would try before dinner.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh. Oh wait! you guys won't be late for my dinner, will you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Believe me, Chandler and I have not seen each other in over a week. We'll probably be the first ones there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'kay, see you there. Happy humping! Hey...hey! Oh, wow, somebody smoked out here? Oh my god, don't people know, you're not allowed to smoke in public spaces?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Actually, in Oklahoma smoking is legal in all common areas and offices with fewer than fifteen people.

utterance.content: You smoked!

utterance.content: Chandler, you stink of cigarettes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, do you think, Monica's gonna be able smell it?

utterance.content: OK, so you wanna play it that way, do you?

utterance.content: Right. You know what? Actually I just got off the plane, so I'm feeling kinda gross. Maybe I should just take a shower.

utterance.content: Yes, but I just had one. Two. Two tiny cigarettes. Okay, five. A pack. Two packs...a...a carton. Three big fat cartons in two days. But it's over, I made a decision, I'm not gonna smoke anymore.

utterance.content: Okay, well that's now the third sign that I should not leave Emma.

utterance.content: Oh, ah...

utterance.content: No, no, really. You should go. Just go! Go! Go out! Really, the world is your oyster. Kick up the heels. Paint the town red.

utterance.content: No! No, you know what? You're not going back in there, the baby's fine, now scram. Yeah, tell your story walking.

utterance.content: I know.

utterance.content: OK, look: Can we just drop this? I'm not gonna smoke again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I'll tell you what we're gonna do: We are already late for Phoebe's birthday dinner, so you put out that cigarette, we're gonna put this fight on hold and go have sex.

The eagle, however, misconstrues as an act of aggression and grabs the baby in its talons. Meanwhile the faucet fills the apartment with water. Baby and bird still ablaze are locked in a death grip, swirling around in the whirl pool that fills the apartment.

utterance.content: No, you're right. We shouldn't do it like this. Huh. For what it's worth, I'm, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have come down on you so hard about the smoking. So you had a few cigarettes, it's not the end of the world.
